people tend to move south. At the top of Hai Van Pass, an interesting scene takes place when heaven and earth seem to be divided into two halves at the top of the pass, one side is cloudy and the other is hot and sunny. Many people
have come from all over to the pass to check it out.  In
this unique natural moment, not only young people, many
tourists in the provinces when coming to Da Nang Hue also
took advantage of the time to take the car to the top of

for a long time, but this is the
first time. It's a majestic scene. It's true
that I've gone up many
Pha Din slopes. Each of these slopes is right
next to the sea.  Its own specialty is
around 10:00 a.m. While looking
towards Da Nang city, the
weather is bright and sunny, while in the direction of Thua
Thien Hue province, the weather is cold and
humid. I really like this place. The scenery
is great.  The special thing I see here
is that the colored blocks are located very close to each other, the
clouds hovering on the top of the mountain, creating a
very close and interesting scene.
This strange weather pattern usually occurs when the
cold air weakens and will weaken.  Ending
in March, this is also the time when

Her Children, the exhibition includes 30 photos of the  The
moment between mother and child was
taken by photographer Le Bich for
nearly 20 years when he traveled from the
Northern mountainous provinces to the Central provinces. The
topic of mother and child is a big topic and there are
many artists.  That's why the artist
is an artist and also
wants to express
professionalism so that it can touch
each person's emotions.
Even if the ethnic group is different, whether the
Mong, Thai Nung, or Kinh people
, it is very natural for a mother to show affection to
her loving children
in every
moment when she sees the image of the mother.  She
may not be too beautiful
or rich, but she always shines
a shadow of love
for her children. On this occasion, photographer
Le Bich donated a set of photos to the
Vietnamese Women's Museum for exhibition.  The exhibition is open to
the public until

incident made many people angry. The clip was recorded by the car's dash cam in the road area near Vinhomes Long Bien, Long Bien district, Hanoi. According to the clip of the incident,  About 4:00 p.m.

men were driving motorbikes on

This young man loudly said that
the woman was not driving carefully and

young man on the car kicked the
woman, causing her to panic and almost fall to the

Long Bien district, Hanoi, said it had

of Australian media companies

Leaders of Brazil's Yanomami tribe
have called for international support to
protect the country's indigenous people from the
impacts of illegal gold mining.
During the process of mining,
gold panners have released mercury into the river,
poisoning fish and humans, killing more than
500 children in the past 4 years, mainly
children under one year old who were poisoned
without treatment.  As time goes on, they become increasingly
malnourished. And then, if they catch
malaria, they will die in just a few hours.
People are buying gold
indiscriminately without even thinking about where this gold comes from.
They don't know that gold can  comes
from the blood of indigenous people across

the exhibition called Insert coin, which means
inserting coins into game machines,
opened on February 29
at m De Paris and lasts.  until June 30
here Players must insert a coin
to use the
machine. About 40 table football machines,

Most of them are still in use.  can and bring

1990, the artifacts become more vivid

That year, the nostalgic atmosphere was also

World Cup mascot Frank 98. Some
artifacts also had price labels in Frank money
before France used the Euro
around the mid-1980s.
There were 300,000 to 400,000
coin-operated video game machines
installed in France, but in the
1990s they were gradually replaced by
personal game machines placed in

location of these game machines has caused

called ees
akiyama.  Australian biology professor
